definition: to draw back the corners of one's mouth
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to arrange/to line up/file/series/(in data tables) column/(Tw) row
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs

sentences.english: Interestingly, he is still unable to defeat Grey Wolf in a fist fight except for rare incidences.
sentences.chinese: 每逢拳腳之爭，他都還不必然鬥得過灰太狼咧。

sentences.english: We're all just waiting with breath to see what you can do around here.
sentences.chinese: 我們都在屏息以待，指望您在這兒大展身手咧。

sentences.english: Well, you look good and sound happy, Gibby .
sentences.chinese: 吉比，你看起來帥多了，聽說還很幸福咧。

sentences.english: How'd you get tickets to this concert? I thought it was sold-out.
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼拿到演唱會的票啊？我還以爲都賣完了咧。

sentences.english: Her small mouth a, the tears brushes of come down.
sentences.chinese: 她小嘴一咧，眼淚刷的就下來了。

sentences.english: Well, I'm saving these pages for all the adventures I'm gonna have.
sentences.chinese: 後面這點空白頁我都留着把後面的冒險寫上去咧。

sentences.english: You can use a little glue or double-sided tape to make it stick securely.
sentences.chinese: 要是花朵折得太厚了咧，可以用膠水或者雙面膠粘牢。

sentences.english: She continued smiling at me, her grin getting sizeably bigger.
sentences.chinese: 她繼續朝我笑笑，她的嘴咧得更大了。

sentences.english: butcher: do you want beef or lamb?
sentences.chinese: 你要來點牛肉還是羊羔肉咧？

sentences.english: I just remembered to a bunch of higher-ups.
sentences.chinese: 想起來我還要一堆頂頭上司批准的咧。

sentences.english: I could feel my grimy face cracking into an incredulous smile.
sentences.chinese: 我能感到自己的髒臉咧出懷疑的笑容。

sentences.english: Can I have your firstborn child?'" she said.
sentences.chinese: 啥時候能見你的第一個孩子咧？

sentences.english: The British singers were, dare I say it, very poor.
sentences.chinese: 這些英國歌手啊，恕我直言，差勁得很咧。

sentences.english: Not just when she opens her mouth, if she ever does. Speaking of…
sentences.chinese: 還不單單只是她撇嘴的表情咧。

sentences.english: He has a grin from ear to ear, making little effort to conceal his pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 他齜着牙，咧大着嘴，對自己的快樂絲毫不作掩飾。

sentences.english: Are we ready to face his grinning hideousness yet?
sentences.chinese: 我們準備好面對他的咧牙了麼？

definition: sentence-final particle similar to 了[le5], but carrying a tone of approval
(modal final particle similar to 呢[ne5] or 啦[la5])
mile (unit of length equal to 1,609.344 m)/old form of modern 英里[Ying1 li3]
(interjection of surprise, pain, annoyance etc)/Oh my!/Uh-oh!/Ah!/Ouch!
(onom.) expressing admiration or surprise/sound of a laugh
(interj. of admiration or of disgust)/to click one's tongue/to attempt to (find an opportunity to) speak
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
